entry.summary: ssp 2025-11-02T14:49:59.058Z@gobino Haven't hit their 10mb/month limit yet! gobino 2025-10-30T13:42:52.000ZProtecting your email identity with free tools (Proton, Duck, Mozilla, Addy) üì±I got more serious about online safety, transitioning from 1 email address to several, outlining why and the (free) tools you can use as well.https://gobino.be/protecting-your-email-identity-with-free-tools-proton-duck-mozilla-addy/#blog hyde 2025-10-30T15:25:39.000Z@gobino have you checked https://aliasvault.net ? gobino 2025-10-30T15:32:52.000Z@hyde crap, I forgot when diving into those tools ü§¶I should have checked and included your solution as well. srgower 2025-10-31T00:06:36.000Z@gobino great write-up! Lots of things I hadn't considered before and more options available than I realized. gobino 2025-10-31T13:08:18.000Z@srgower thanks!Yea, I also wasn‚Äôt aware or thinking about it all. Everyone needs to define for themselves what to do, but I feel I‚Äôve been too lenient with everything.And if you have any questions, shoot. ssp 2025-10-31T23:13:28.889Z@gobino I've been using addy.io for about three years now. Super reliable and I love their on-the-go alias generation. gobino 2025-11-01T10:30:51.000Z@ssp Yea, it looks to be a very gold and solid solution.Are you still using the free tier? Or did you upgrade?

2025-10-30T13:42:52.000Z
Protecting your email identity with free tools (Proton, Duck, Mozilla, Addy) üì±I got more serious about online safety, transitioning from 1 email address to several, outlining why and the (free) tools you can use as well.https://gobino.be/protecting-your-email-identity-with-free-tools-proton-duck-mozilla-addy/#blog

2025-10-31T13:08:18.000Z

entry.summary: ssp 2025-10-26T22:17:43.193Z@hund Not quite. I have a script that fetches all my activity data from Garmin Connect every month or so. For now I just generate raw summaries and a few maps churned out of it. Just something fun to tinker with once in a while. Pretty psyched about Gadget bridge though! hund 2025-10-26T16:20:55.000ZI replaced Garmin Connect with Gadgetbridge. It's open source, and it runs offline on your device.It seems to have all the essential features. I even have "smart notifications" on my watch.https://f-droid.org/packages/nodomain.freeyourgadget.gadgetbridge#Garmin #Gadgetbridge #Android #Fdroid ClintonAnderson 2025-10-26T16:25:18.000Z@hundAnd it be used while Connect is still installed, to test it???? hund 2025-10-26T17:12:58.000Z@ClintonAnderson It should work if you unpair the watch first. ClintonAnderson 2025-10-26T17:14:30.000Z@hundCool!Worth a try for fun at least killyourfm 2025-10-26T16:26:38.000Z@hund üëÄInteresting. Garmin Connect is infuriating. It can't seem to display ANYTHING without your phone having an internet connection. It can't even sync without data, which seems ludicrous. You'd think it would be a straightforward bluetooth connection. (All of this means when I'm in the backcountry or very remote, I can't see activity data, sleep data, or sometimes even calories burned.)How does Gadgetbridge handle that? hund 2025-10-26T17:14:17.000Z@killyourfm It's all local on your phone. As long as Bluetooth work, you're good to go. :) killyourfm 2025-10-26T19:18:58.000Z@hund BRILLIANT! hund 2025-10-26T19:23:02.000Z@killyourfm :D zlatin 2025-10-26T17:30:06.000Z@hund Have you managed to somehow transfer your history data from Garmin Connect to Gadgetbridge? hund 2025-10-26T17:40:24.000Z@zlatin Nope. I haven't looked into that yet. :) ssp 2025-10-26T19:56:33.334ZThis is fantastic, @hund ! Thanks for the nudge! I did try Gadgetbridge a few years ago. They didn't quite support Garmin then. Gave it a spin just now and looks like they've come a long way! So far I've been exporting my garmin to my site but nothing like a full fledged app with all the bells and whistles.https://srikanthperinkulam.com/2025/10/26/gadget-bridge/ hund 2025-10-26T21:39:15.000Z@ssp I'm glad that you found value in my post!Have you created your own fitness tracker website thingy or what?I honestly don't know what to do with my data.. I only find value in resent data, so I can keep track of my current fitness and how active I've been. oecher_olli 2025-10-31T14:36:01.000Z@hund Muss ich doch direkt einmal ausprobieren hund 2025-10-31T14:38:14.000Z@oecher_olli Good luck!
entry.content:
ssp
2025-10-26T22:17:43.193Z
@hund Not quite. I have a script that fetches all my activity data from Garmin Connect every month or so. For now I just generate raw summaries and a few maps churned out of it. Just something fun to tinker with once in a while. Pretty psyched about Gadget bridge though!
hund
2025-10-26T16:20:55.000Z
I replaced Garmin Connect with Gadgetbridge. It's open source, and it runs offline on your device.It seems to have all the essential features. I even have "smart notifications" on my watch.https://f-droid.org/packages/nodomain.freeyourgadget.gadgetbridge#Garmin #Gadgetbridge #Android #Fdroid
ClintonAnderson
2025-10-26T16:25:18.000Z
@hundAnd it be used while Connect is still installed, to test it????
hund
2025-10-26T17:12:58.000Z
@ClintonAnderson It should work if you unpair the watch first.
ClintonAnderson
2025-10-26T17:14:30.000Z
@hundCool!Worth a try for fun at least
killyourfm
2025-10-26T16:26:38.000Z
@hund üëÄInteresting. Garmin Connect is infuriating. It can't seem to display ANYTHING without your phone having an internet connection. It can't even sync without data, which seems ludicrous. You'd think it would be a straightforward bluetooth connection. (All of this means when I'm in the backcountry or very remote, I can't see activity data, sleep data, or sometimes even calories burned.)How does Gadgetbridge handle that?
hund
2025-10-26T17:14:17.000Z
@killyourfm It's all local on your phone. As long as Bluetooth work, you're good to go. :)
killyourfm
2025-10-26T19:18:58.000Z
@hund BRILLIANT!
hund
2025-10-26T19:23:02.000Z
@killyourfm :D
zlatin
2025-10-26T17:30:06.000Z
@hund Have you managed to somehow transfer your history data from Garmin Connect to Gadgetbridge?
hund
2025-10-26T17:40:24.000Z
@zlatin Nope. I haven't looked into that yet. :)
ssp
2025-10-26T19:56:33.334Z
This is fantastic, @hund ! Thanks for the nudge! I did try Gadgetbridge a few years ago. They didn't quite support Garmin then. Gave it a spin just now and looks like they've come a long way! So far I've been exporting my garmin to my site but nothing like a full fledged app with all the bells and whistles.https://srikanthperinkulam.com/2025/10/26/gadget-bridge/
hund
2025-10-26T21:39:15.000Z
@ssp I'm glad that you found value in my post!Have you created your own fitness tracker website thingy or what?I honestly don't know what to do with my data.. I only find value in resent data, so I can keep track of my current fitness and how active I've been.
oecher_olli
2025-10-31T14:36:01.000Z
@hund Muss ich doch direkt einmal ausprobieren
hund
2025-10-31T14:38:14.000Z
@oecher_olli Good luck!
